page.title: 09Medical Facilities
page.content: There are three hospitals in the area.The Wilson Hospital is the smallest one .It was opened in 1928 and deals mainly with orthopaedic comlpaints. The Wandle Valley Hospital was opened in 1899 as an isolation hospital.It was sited in the Wandle Valley because residents of Carshalton objected to those suffering from contageous diseases being near to the village.It is primarily a psychiatric and geriatric hospital today. St.Helier, the largest hospital in the area, is also part of the Merton, Sutton and Wandsworth Area Health Authority, as are the other hospitals. When it was built in 1938/9 it was one of the most modern in the world. It is now in the process of being modernised and a revamped Maternity Unit will be opened in December 1985.
